intro: Capsella bremensis, commonly known as the Bremen knotweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. The flowers are pale yellow and produce small, round pods that contain several seeds.
